after mom died I started straightening
my hair
and I never thought twice about wearing

I'm proud of being biracial such a great

Ruth riggy and special guest Cassidy
Freeland hey guys I'm so excited to be
here we are so excited to have you thank
you all so much for joining us now what
I love about this episode is it really
took a deep dive into the black hair
experience figuring out your hair type
which Styles work for you just embracing
your natural hair what was it like
getting to tell that story I mean I feel
so grateful to be able to share Sydney's
experience with you know learning more
about our cultural identity and how she
expresses that through understanding and
then styling her own hair when reading
the script I was so excited because so
many children with curly hair especially
with more tight curl patterns often
aren't encouraged by Society to embrace
their hair in its natural state many of
us are told that we need to straighten
our hair or in Alicia's case perm our
hair in order to fit in we should never
feel like we need to change what we
think is beautiful to conform to another
person's idea of beauty and I know
growing up I didn't see many TV shows
that really talked about yes I think
there's such a stigma around hair in
general there's definitely been a lot of
you know lack of representation with
black hair and TV that's why it's so
important that Ruthie and I were given
this opportunity to knock down those
beliefs and let our audience know that
they are already so beautiful in their
own natural way as well snaps for that
now Ruth as someone who's biracial what
has your relationship with your girl's
been like when I was younger I used to
see my friends with straight or super
curly hair and just wonder why mine
didn't look like theirs but now I know
that biracial hair comes in all
different colors and all different
textures it doesn't have to be super
curly or super straight or really
anything in particular because it's
varied and special to each person
Cassidy I wanted to ask you about the
scene where your character says
straightening her hair makes her feel

couldn't stop smiling in between takes
because I knew how much of an impact

different audiences overall filming was
an amazing and extremely rewarding

you do this in every single episode it's
so amazing I admire you for it ah you
both are incredible now can we talk
about why hair is such a big deal and
such a huge part of the black experience
what's so beautiful is the versatility
of black hair and biracial hair and I
think that it's such an essential part
of you know our identity and it's it's a
way to express ourselves as a black
woman have been told for hundreds of
years that our hair is what makes us
less proper and less put together the
black community and other communities of
color have in response worked really
hard together to address and fix these
unjust mindsets so that black children
can grow up knowing that their hair is
beautifully unique and amazing just the
way it is has your hair ever made you
the subject of microaggressions just
people assuming I'm a certain race
because of my hair or or making comments
that it's not enough of whatever race
they assume I am when I was younger
people used to touch my hair all the
time and only sometimes what they ask
curly hair isn't a toy and treating it
as such can be very very invalidating
even if it isn't the person's intent in
school you know a lot of times my hair
was told that it was too distracting or
that I couldn't wear certain Style or
that my Styles weren't allowed whether
it be braids or natural or beads or
anything it just wasn't allowed at my
school and it's almost scary to know
that our hair is looked at as almost a
threat as to why we shouldn't wear it in
schools or for businesses or that it's
not professional it's just really
disheartening and that's why I'm so glad
that I'm able to use my platform to
display different types of natural hair
and to show girls that whatever you want
to rock it's beautiful like no matter
what nobody else says you are beautiful
your hair is beautiful and continue to
